result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael C Parrish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael C Parrish

defendant.name: Parrish, Michael C
defendant.address: N7820 Maple Hill Road, Ladysmith, WI 54848

records.addlTxt: Case settlement
DE has indicated undecided about seeking PCR

1:03 PM Defendant Michael C Parrish in court.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Michael C Parrish.  Heard along with 21CF80, 22CF7.  Agreement has been reached in these matters. Court recites agreement into the court record.  

21CF80-Waiver of PSI.  Sentence will be for 6 years in WI Prison System consisting of 3 in/3out, concurrent with each other, but consecutive to 2011CF127 if revoked from probation, sentence will be Imposed and Stayed. Will order 3 years probation. DE will complete an AODA assessment and any follow up treatment recommended, comply with all DOC recommendations, comply with all SOR rules, pay CC, provide DNA/pay surcharge.  

22CF7-DE will enter a plea to Ct 1, with repeater dismissed.  Ct 2 will be DRI.

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court accepts plea of G, finds DE guilty. 

Sentencing argument entered by parties. Mr Parrish makes a statement to the court, states he is really trying to pull his life together, has employment, housing, counseling.  Court will accept the recommended sentence. 15 days credit.

04:01 PM Defendant Michael C Parrish in court with attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 21CF80, 22CF7.  22CF7-DE/Atty will wiave PH.  Court instructs on waiver of PH, DE understands waiver, makes waiver knowingly, freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver of PH. Court finds PC exists, will bind over for Trial.  Set for RH May 20, 2022 @ 1:00PM. Adj 4:06PM,
Review hearing on May 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 5, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 5, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

01:15 PM Defendant Michael C Parrish in court with attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow.  Emily Margaret Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive formal reading of the CC.  DE will waive TL for PH, DE instructs on waiver of TL, DE understands waiver, court will accept waiver of TL. Set for PH April 5, 2022 @ 4:00PM. Adj 1:19pm  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

DE will pick up application for court appointed counsel.  Atty Knaak will provide the court with a copy of the determination for ineligibilty.  Set for PH February 1, 2022 @ 1:30PM. Adj 2:05pm

Michael C Parrish appeared by video means with Attorney.    Waive formal reading of the CC.  DE/Atty will waive TL for PH, court instructs on waiver of TL, DE understands waiver, court accepts waiver of TL.  Set for PH January 18, 2022 @ 1:30PM.  In person hearing.  Bond remains.  Adj 3:05PM. No contact with AS will be added to the bond. Adj 3:07pm.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.    No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia. 8:20am DE appears from RC jail, Atty Harless appears with DE via ZOOM.  State appears by ADA Nelson. 8:24 am- Atty Harless and DE go into a breakout room.  8:37am back on the record.  State recommends current bond remain which is a $1000.00 cash.  Atty Harless argues for a signature bond, DE has been a resident of Rusk County for 20 years, has employment at Besse Lumber, has a child in the area. 

The court will order a $2500.00 sign bond,   No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.    Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Set for Init App January 11, 2022 @ 1:00PM.  DE will be incarcerated until he believes the 12, 13 of January, sitting on a city citation.  Adj 8:42am.

3:09 PM  DE Michael Parrish appeared from the Rusk County Jail.   ADA Emily Nelson appeared in person.   DE currently on a $1000 cash bond.  DE requested his bond be modified to a signature bond so he can return to work at Betsy Lumber.   DE stated he called PD office but he has not heard back from them as to representation.   Court informed DE the PD office will be called so an attorney from PD office can represent him tomorrow at a bond hearing.    Court set matter for 1/7/22 at 8:00 AM.  Adj. 3:13 PM.
Letter for bond modification
Any cash bond posted for Defendant shall be used for fines, costs and restitution pursuant to WI STAT 969.13(5)
